com.mta.tehreer.text

Class TextLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mta.tehreer.text.TextLine

  • public class TextLine
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a line of text consisting of an array of TextRun objects in visual order.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(Renderer renderer, android.graphics.Canvas canvas, float x, float y)
      Draws this line onto the given canvas using the given renderer.
      float getAscent()
      Returns the ascent of this line which is the maximum ascent from the baseline of all the runs in the TextLine.
      int getCharEnd()
      Returns the index after the last character of this line in source text.
      int getCharStart()
      Returns the index to the first character of this line in source text.
      float getDescent()
      Returns the descent of this line which is the maximum descent from the baseline of all the runs in the TextLine.
      float getFlushPenOffset(float flushFactor, float flushWidth)
      Returns the pen offset required to draw flush text.
      float getOriginX()
      Returns the x- origin of this line in parent frame.
      float getOriginY()
      Returns the y- origin of this line in parent frame.
      java.util.List<TextRun> getRuns()
      Returns a readonly list that contains all the runs of this line.
      float getTrailingWhitespaceWidth()
      Returns the advance width of the glyphs corresponding to trailing whitespace characters of this line in source text.
      float getWidth()
      Returns the advance width of all glyphs in this line.
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • getFlushPenOffset

        public float getFlushPenOffset(float flushFactor,
                               float flushWidth)
        Returns the pen offset required to draw flush text.
        Parameters:
        flushFactor - Specifies the kind of flushness. A flush factor of 0 or less indicates left flush. A flushFactor of 1.0 or more indicates right flush. Flush factors between 0 and 1.0 indicate varying degrees of center flush, with a value of 0.5 being totally center flush.
        flushWidth - Specifies the width that the flushness operation should apply to.
        Returns:
        A value which can be used to offset the current pen position for the flush operation.

      • draw

        public void draw(Renderer renderer,
                 android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                 float x,
                 float y)
        Draws this line onto the given canvas using the given renderer.
        Parameters:
        renderer - The renderer to use for drawing this line.
        canvas - The canvas onto which to draw this line.
        x - The x- position at which to draw this line.
        y - The y- position at which to draw this line.
